VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted three acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The facility completed and complied with the Renewal CAP submitted in February
2023. Mandatory specific retraining was provided to supervisors and staff after two
supervisors performed an unjustified restraint and identified it as an escort. A
supervisor was terminated, multiple staff meetings were held and an additional
camera was installed after supervisor encouraged two youths to beat a third youth
behind the facility's garage.
Financial Overview
There were no financial concerns identified in the annual audit reviewed.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
One Renewal and two special investigation CAPs were submitted during this
inspection period. The chief administrator did not identify any additional needs.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff feel they receive the appropriate training to perform their job duties and can
freely discuss any issues or concerns with their supervisors.
Youth reported feeling safe and enjoy the recreational activities offered at the
facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
I observed the kitchen, refrigerators, freezer, dining room, living room, playrooms,
staff office and youth bedrooms. The facility is clean and organized with a homey
atmosphere.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
